The transformation studied involves the integral transformation \\( T(z) = \\int_{0}^{t} e^{i\\omega s} z(s) ds \\).

If \\( T(z) \\) is applied to a function \\( z_0(t) = x_0 + iy_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\dot{z} = i\\omega z \\) without further intervention, does the trajectory of \\( z(t) \\) match the original evolution of \\( z_0(t) \\) without using \\( T(z) \\)?
Explanation: Applying \\( T(z) \\) changes the trajectory from a simple exponential growth to one that integrates past states of the system due to the transformation's accumulating nature. This makes the new system trajectory different from the unaltered exponential evolution.
